name: JSONRPCMessage
comment: Refers to any valid JSON-RPC object that can be decoded off the wire, or encoded to be sent.
nodeText:
export type JSONRPCMessage =
  | JSONRPCRequest
  | JSONRPCNotification
  | JSONRPCBatchRequest
  | JSONRPCResponse
  | JSONRPCError
  | JSONRPCBatchResponse;

astStructure.name: JSONRPCMessage
astStructure.type:
| JSONRPCRequest
  | JSONRPCNotification
  | JSONRPCBatchRequest
  | JSONRPCResponse
  | JSONRPCError
  | JSONRPCBatchResponse

name: JSONRPCBatchRequest
comment: A JSON-RPC batch request, as described in https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#batch.
nodeText: export type JSONRPCBatchRequest = (JSONRPCRequest | JSONRPCNotification)[];

name: JSONRPCBatchResponse
comment: A JSON-RPC batch response, as described in https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#batch.
nodeText: export type JSONRPCBatchResponse = (JSONRPCResponse | JSONRPCError)[];

name: Cursor
comment: An opaque token used to represent a cursor for pagination.
nodeText: export type Cursor = string;

name: Request

members.name: params
_meta
progressToken
members.comment: If specified, the caller is requesting out-of-band progress notifications for this request (as represented by notifications/progress). The value of this parameter is an opaque token that will be attached to any subsequent notifications. The receiver is not obligated to provide these notifications.

name: Notification

members.name: params
_meta
members.comment: This parameter name is reserved by MCP to allow clients and servers to attach additional metadata to their notifications.

name: Result

members.name: _meta
members.comment: This result property is reserved by the protocol to allow clients and servers to attach additional metadata to their responses.

name: RequestId
comment: A uniquely identifying ID for a request in JSON-RPC.
nodeText: export type RequestId = string | number;

name: JSONRPCRequest
comment: A request that expects a response.

name: JSONRPCNotification
comment: A notification which does not expect a response.

name: JSONRPCResponse
comment: A successful (non-error) response to a request.

name: JSONRPCError
comment: A response to a request that indicates an error occurred.

members.name: error
code
members.comment: The error type that occurred.

members.name: message
members.comment: A short description of the error. The message SHOULD be limited to a concise single sentence.

members.name: data
members.comment: Additional information about the error. The value of this member is defined by the sender (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

name: EmptyResult
comment: A response that indicates success but carries no data.
nodeText: export type EmptyResult = Result;

name: InitializeRequest
comment: This request is sent from the client to the server when it first connects, asking it to begin initialization.

members.name: params
protocolVersion
members.comment: The latest version of the Model Context Protocol that the client supports. The client MAY decide to support older versions as well.

name: InitializeResult
comment: After receiving an initialize request from the client, the server sends this response.

members.name: protocolVersion
members.comment: The version of the Model Context Protocol that the server wants to use. This may not match the version that the client requested. If the client cannot support this version, it MUST disconnect.

members.name: instructions
members.comment:
Instructions describing how to use the server and its features.

This can be used by clients to improve the LLM's understanding of available tools, resources, etc. It can be thought of like a "hint" to the model. For example, this information MAY be added to the system prompt.

name: InitializedNotification
comment: This notification is sent from the client to the server after initialization has finished.

name: ClientCapabilities
comment: Capabilities a client may support. Known capabilities are defined here, in this schema, but this is not a closed set: any client can define its own, additional capabilities.

members.name: experimental
members.comment: Experimental, non-standard capabilities that the client supports.

members.name: roots
members.comment: Present if the client supports listing roots.

members.name: listChanged
members.comment: Whether the client supports notifications for changes to the roots list.

members.name: sampling
members.comment: Present if the client supports sampling from an LLM.

name: ServerCapabilities
comment: Capabilities that a server may support. Known capabilities are defined here, in this schema, but this is not a closed set: any server can define its own, additional capabilities.

members.name: experimental
members.comment: Experimental, non-standard capabilities that the server supports.

members.name: logging
members.comment: Present if the server supports sending log messages to the client.

members.name: completions
members.comment: Present if the server supports argument autocompletion suggestions.

members.name: prompts
members.comment: Present if the server offers any prompt templates.

members.name: listChanged
members.comment: Whether this server supports notifications for changes to the prompt list.

members.name: resources
members.comment: Present if the server offers any resources to read.

members.name: subscribe
members.comment: Whether this server supports subscribing to resource updates.

members.name: listChanged
members.comment: Whether this server supports notifications for changes to the resource list.

members.name: tools
members.comment: Present if the server offers any tools to call.

members.name: listChanged
members.comment: Whether this server supports notifications for changes to the tool list.

name: Implementation
comment: Describes the name and version of an MCP implementation.

name: PingRequest
comment: A ping, issued by either the server or the client, to check that the other party is still alive. The receiver must promptly respond, or else may be disconnected.

name: PaginatedRequest

members.name: params
cursor
members.comment:
An opaque token representing the current pagination position.
If provided, the server should return results starting after this cursor.

name: PaginatedResult

members.name: nextCursor
members.comment:
An opaque token representing the pagination position after the last returned result.
If present, there may be more results available.

name: ListToolsRequest
comment: Sent from the client to request a list of tools the server has.

name: ListToolsResult
comment: The server's response to a tools/list request from the client.

name: CallToolResult
comment:
The server's response to a tool call.

Any errors that originate from the tool SHOULD be reported inside the result
object, with `isError` set to true, _not_ as an MCP protocol-level error
response. Otherwise, the LLM would not be able to see that an error occurred
and self-correct.

However, any errors in _finding_ the tool, an error indicating that the
server does not support tool calls, or any other exceptional conditions,
should be reported as an MCP error response.

members.name: isError
members.comment:
Whether the tool call ended in an error.

If not set, this is assumed to be false (the call was successful).

name: CallToolRequest
comment: Used by the client to invoke a tool provided by the server.

name: ToolListChangedNotification
comment: An optional notification from the server to the client, informing it that the list of tools it offers has changed. This may be issued by servers without any previous subscription from the client.

name: ToolAnnotations
comment:
Additional properties describing a Tool to clients.

NOTE: all properties in ToolAnnotations are **hints**.
They are not guaranteed to provide a faithful description of
tool behavior (including descriptive properties like `title`).

Clients should never make tool use decisions based on ToolAnnotations
received from untrusted servers.

members.name: title
members.comment: A human-readable title for the tool.

members.name: readOnlyHint
members.comment:
If true, the tool does not modify its environment.

Default: false

members.name: destructiveHint
members.comment:
If true, the tool may perform destructive updates to its environment.
If false, the tool performs only additive updates.

(This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`)

Default: true

members.name: idempotentHint
members.comment:
If true, calling the tool repeatedly with the same arguments
will have no additional effect on the its environment.

(This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`)

Default: false

members.name: openWorldHint
members.comment:
If true, this tool may interact with an "open world" of external
entities. If false, the tool's domain of interaction is closed.
For example, the world of a web search tool is open, whereas that
of a memory tool is not.

Default: true

name: Tool
comment: Definition for a tool the client can call.

members.name: name
members.comment: The name of the tool.

members.name: description
members.comment:
A human-readable description of the tool.

This can be used by clients to improve the LLM's understanding of available tools. It can be thought of like a "hint" to the model.

members.name: inputSchema
members.comment: A JSON Schema object defining the expected parameters for the tool.

members.name: annotations
members.comment: Optional additional tool information.

name: ClientRequest
ClientNotification
nodeText:
export type ClientNotification =
  | InitializedNotification;

name: ClientResult
nodeText: export type ClientResult = EmptyResult;

name: ServerRequest
nodeText: export type ServerRequest = PingRequest;

name: ServerNotification
nodeText:
export type ServerNotification =
  | ToolListChangedNotification;

name: ServerResult
